events.name: INTERACT_COOLDOWN
events.comment: How frequently (in seconds) to let the player interact with things.

events.name: ANIMATION_DIVISOR
events.comment: number by which to divide the movement speed to obtain the animation speed

events.name: ARC
events.comment: The number of degrees in a circle divided by the number of angles our assets have.

events.name: ISOMETRIC_DIVIDER
events.comment: The number by which to divide projectile's and character's height to be properly isometric

events.name: nextAvailableIdentifier
events.comment: Stores the next available identifier, to be assigned to equipment

events.name: uidOfClicked
events.comment: the UID of the out-of-range object that was clicked

children.name: dialogOpen
children.comment: Whether or not the player is talking to an NPC

children.name: portraitPosition
children.comment: The position on the X axis of where the portrait should spawn

actions.text: TODO: Make sure this works with multiple NPCs
if we click anywhere that's not an NPC, and there's a portrait up (that's not currently fading out), close the dialog

children.functionDescription: Begin dialog with an NPC.

parameters.value: round(angle(Self.X, Self.Y, player.X, player.Y) / ARC) * ARC

actions.text: ...if a portrait for it already exists, do nothing
…otherwise, destroy all portraits, and spawn a portrait for this NPC
parent it to the mana cover so it resizes correctly. We would use anchor, but we can't set its parameters during the runtime
override the global timescale so we can still fade out on pause

children.functionDescription: End dialog with an NPC.

children.name: swapID
children.comment: the identifier of the equipped item, so we can swap it

children.name: swapSlotUID
children.comment: the UID of the original slot in a swap

children.name: draggedOriginSlotUID
children.comment: the UID of the slot the drag originated from

children.name: dragCacheItemUID
children.comment: the UID of the item we're dragging

children.name: dragCacheSlotUID
children.comment: the UID of the slot we dropped on

actions.text: Development: so we can spawn loot quickly

children.functionDescription: Picking up loot and turning it into an item

actions.text: if auto equip is enabled, and the player's class matches the loot's restrictions, pick the first empty slot matching the loot's type, and spawn the item there
if auto equip is disabled, or there's no empty slots matching the item's type, spawn the item in the first empty inventory slot.

children.functionDescription: set the variables on an item, from its loot
spawn loot at the specified location

children.name: modValueRegex
children.comment: the regex that will return the first mod value

children.name: modValue
children.comment: The text inside the brackets of a given mod

actions.text: for each set of square brackets in this loot's mods

children.name: lowerLimit
children.comment: the lowest number that this mod can roll

children.name: upperLimit
children.comment: the highest number that this mod can roll

actions.text: if this particular value contains a dash, it's a numeric value

children.text: Set a numeric mod's value to a random number between the lower and upper limit. Higher numbers are rarer. The rarity of higher numbers diminishingly scales with the loot level.
TODO: Negative values - should lower numbers be better? or worse?

children.name: total
children.comment: the total weight of all possible mod values, unconverted

actions.text: the number of Xs in the mod value is the number of decimal places to shift the result. We have to do it this way because of floating point math problems
We can remove an entire mod table, so remove the entries the same way we added them

children.text: For text mod values, select a choice at random

actions.text: if it doesn't, it should contain a dollar sign, which means it's a text value

children.functionDescription: Standardize the possible value of a mod to a uniform range

functionParameters.name: lowerLimit
functionParameters.comment: the lowest number that this mod can roll

functionParameters.name: upperLimit
functionParameters.comment: the highest number that this mod can roll

functionParameters.name: currentLoopindex
functionParameters.comment: the loopindex of the current loop over possible mod values

actions.text: if an item is right clicked, and both the inventory and character menus are open, pick the slot the item is in
if the item is in the character menu
check to see if there's any empty inventory slots the item can go into
if there are, detach the item from its current slot
then attach it to the first empty inventory slot
if the item is in the inventory menu, and can be equipped
pick the slots that match the item's type
of those slots, check if any are empty
now that we know there's an empty character slot for this item, go back to the slot holding our item, and detach
re-pick the first empty character slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it
if no slots are empty, start the *swap*: pick the first slot and store its identifier, which is also the identifier of the item in it
go back to the slot holding our item, and detach. save this slots UID so we know where to put the other item
for some reason this isn't a function and I'm too scared to change it to one
re-pick the first character slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it, even though it has an different item in it

now we have both items in the same slot. we'll detach the item that shouldn't be there, picking it with swapID. We don't need to clear the identifier value because it was already set correctly in the previous event
it'll go where the other item left, which we have saved in previousLocationUID
when an item starts being dragged, record where it came from, set dragging to true, and detach it
This ensures whatever is being dragged is always on top
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear appropriately
if the cursor was over a slot
and the item can't go into that slot, because of one of the following reasons:
that slot's type doesn't match the item's type, and that slot's type is also not "none"
that item's class doesn't match the player's class, and the item's class is not "All Classes", and that slot's type is not "none"
that item's level is higher than the player's level, and that slot's type is not "none"
extracting "slot.type <> "none"" to a parent event doesn't allow the 'else' event to properly fire, if none of these conditions are met
send the item back to the slot it came from
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
and that slot was a character slot that matches the item's type, or is "none"
and that slot is empty, attach the item to it
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
and that slot is not empty, save its identifier (which is also its item's identifier) so we can overwrite it
check if the item can go back to the origin slot
if it can, re-pick the item being dragged, and the slot we dropped it on, and attach them
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
now pick and detach the overlapped item that shouldn't be there (but the slot's identifier is OK), and pick the origin slot, and attach the two
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
if it can't, don't swap, and send the item being dragged back to the origin slot
if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately
if the cursor was over an invalid location, send the item back to the slot it came from
if the cursor was over the game world background, spawn its loot
transfer data from item to loot, then destroy the item

children.functionDescription: attaches an item to a slot
detaches an item from a slot
Send an item back to whatever it came from, if it was dropped in an ineligible location.

actions.text: if it came from a character slot, manage the gear and mods appropriately

children.functionDescription: Add a request to manage gear to the queue

actions.text: as long as the slot's type is not neck or ring...

children.name: gearToSpawn
children.comment: the name of the gear to spawn

children.name: gearToDestroy
children.comment: the name of the gear to destroy

children.name: gearToDestroyUID
children.comment: the UID of the gear to destroy

actions.text: if it's not empty, pick the item that's currently in that slot
destroy the existing gear that correlates with the slot's type, if it exists
if it's empty, pick the gear that correlates with the slot's type
if it's legs or head, or chest and not a man, (the slots with visual representation that have default gear), load the default gear
if there's no gear, that means the game has just started, and we just need to spawn default gear
unblock in this subevent, where we can guarantee the gear exists
if we're only creating gear and not destroying any, the previous event won't run, so this needs to be separate
if we're destroying gear without creating gear, we can instantly destroy it without waiting
This event needs to be above the sorting group to prevent a graphical glitch. This uses Image Point 1 if it exists, otherwise it defaults to Image Point 0.
This event must be below the above event, or else the loot will flash when the z order of its parent prop changes.
If a piece of loot is on the 'main' layer, it's part of the environment, and needs to be moved in front of whatever it's 'on', i.e., the prop that is its parent.

children.title: sorting
children.description: Check for edge cases to indicate utilization of a custom sorting order, otherwise use the default.

actions.text: The normal sorting order.

The "scroll to" behavior, but still clamp to the right edge even though the layout continues, while not in a building. We don't have to do this for the Y because the top and bottom of the layout is also the play area edges.
TODO: the player to be created is determined on the character selection screen
somehow the default 'head' is spawning before the body's name can be referenced. this 'wait 0' fixes that.
these events to spawn default gear need to be nested, and I don't know why
if there's 1 body and 3 gears, the character has finished loading

children.functionDescription: Update the facing of the player.

actions.text: this is a function so it can be called in the middle of an ability function
both -180 and 180 are possible outcomes, so compensate for the one that doesn't have an animation
Regenerate health and mana while not at the maximum values.
Regenerate health only when alive.
isometrically correct movement
the redundancy here can probably only be solved with inheritance, which Construct currently doesn't have
When an enemy is left clicked, check to see if it's within attack range. If it isn't, move so that it is. If it is, check to make sure the player isn't in a non-combat area, then attack.
Boost the pick up range by the approximate size of the item, and it's apparent vertical height
if the mouse isn't over any of the specified, reset uidOfClicked and walk there normally
we don't need to check that it's 0 for this to function, however it saves us from evaluating each sub-event's condition
As soon as the enemy comes in range, stop moving and attack it.
when we arrive somewhere, if we had a UID saved of something, call a function based off of what it is

children.text: The below 2 events have to be here. Do not move them elsewhere. If you do, gear will desynchronize and abilities will break.

actions.text: ...if they're moving (and not where they were last tick), set their animation appropriately
if they were idling, start the animation from the beginning
if they were already walking, play the animation from the current frame

children.name: PROJECTILE_SPEED
children.comment: The speed of the projectile

children.name: MANIFESTATION_POINT
children.comment: The longest possible distance (in pixels) between the enemy origin and where the projectile visual representation should appear.. This is when they are facing directly left or right.

children.name: MANIFESTATION_FRAME
children.comment: The (0-based) frame in which the projectile should manifest

children.name: SIZE
children.comment: The size of the projectile

children.name: projectileManifestationTime
children.comment: How long it takes the projectile to get from the enemy's origin to the manifestation point

actions.text: The point in time when the projectile should appear differs based on which direction the enemy is facing. (i.e., the distance between the enemy's origin and hand is drastically different if he's facing left, vs. if he's facing up)
Time the spawning of the projectile so it will pass over the manifestation point during the same frame that the the projectile's visual representation on the enemy disappears.
Adjust the projectile's speed to account for isometry.
If we set the angle before we set the speed, and the speed of the template projectile is 0, this projectile will only flight straight left or right.
The projectile is now at the manifestation point. Spawn the projectile's visual representation.

actions.text: If the enemy was hit between the time when the attack started, but before the projectile was generated, cease continuation with the attack.

children.text: we tried a lot of different things to get shadows to stay immediately behind their hasShadow. A 'for' loop over the shadows moving them behind their hasShadow didn't work, neither did the Z elevation hierarchy parameter. We just decided to make shadows sortable, that seems to be working.

actions.text: If the player has an offHand item equipped, and successfully blocks the attack, just play the block animation, then we're done.

children.functionDescription: Find the X coordinate of a point that's along a line between 2 points, a specified distance away from the 2nd point.

parameters.value: Point2X + cos(angle(Point2X, Point2Y, Point1X, Point1Y)) * distanceAwayFromPoint2

children.functionDescription: Find the Y coordinate of a point that's along a line between 2 points, a specified distance away from the 2nd point.

parameters.value: Point2Y + sin(angle(Point2X, Point2Y, Point1X, Point1Y)) * distanceAwayFromPoint2

children.functionDescription: Modify a value based on an angle, to make it isometrically correct.

functionParameters.comment: The angle, which will be used to modify the speed.

actions.text: "nAngle" because "angle" is a reserved keyword.

children.functionDescription: look up a value in an array

actions.text: pick the array that was passed (the calling event might not pick it, so we can't use "copy picked")
loop through the column headers to find the columns we want
"stop loop" doesn't work with the array loops. using a standard loop with arrays.width wasn't working either for some reason
this line cannot be combined into the previous line

loop through the cells of just that column to find the value we want, skipping the header row. Once we find it, set returnValue to the value of the cell located in that row but column of targetColumnNumber
once we have a return value, stop the loop (we're not sure if setting a return value also ends the function)
